byline.original: By ALAN COWELL, LAURA KASINOF and ADAM NOSSITER
byline.contributor: Alan Cowell reported from London, Laura Kasinof from Sana, Yemen, and Adam Nossiter from Monrovia, Liberia. Reporting was contributed by Heba Afify from Cairo, Anthony Shadid from Istanbul, Turkey, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

snippet: President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf of Liberia, her compatriot Leymah Gbowee and Tawakkol Karman of Yemen won the Nobel Peace Prize on Friday for their nonviolent activism.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf of Liberia, her compatriot Leymah Gbowee and Tawakkol Karman of Yemen won the Nobel Peace Prize on Friday for their nonviolent activism.

headline.main: Nobel Peace Prize Awarded to Three Activist Women
headline.print_headline: Nobel Peace Prize Awarded to Three Activist Women
headline.seo: Nobel Peace Prize Awarded to Ellen Johnson Sirleaf, Leymah Gbowee and Tawakkol Karman
